thread.title: Trial ordered in murder of bikie associate | The
thread.title_full: Trial ordered in murder of bikie associate | The Courier-Mail

author: couriermail.com.au
title: Trial ordered in murder of bikie associate | The
text:
A Brisbane magistrate committed Shane Anthony Eric Hansen to trial today charged with murdering 31-year-old Finks associate Darren Britza at Southport in 2001.
Britza vanished in March 2001 but it wasn’t until 2008 that his remains were found in a shallow grave at Boyland in the Gold Coast hinterland.
Last year a Brisbane magistrate ruled Hansen had no case to answer on the murder charge.
But he faced a second committal hearing on Friday after a witness came forward.
Darren John Britza was killed in 2001. Source: News Limited
The Brisbane Magistrates Court heard Hansen’s former associate Paul Taylor contacted Crime Stoppers anonymously in 2010 and was interviewed by police in 2012.
However it wasn’t until after Hansen was discharged due to lack of evidence at his first committal hearing in January 2014 that Mr Taylor gave a formal statement.
Under courtroom examination Mr Taylor said he didn’t make one earlier because he was afraid.
“I was scared for the safety of my children,” Mr Taylor told the court.
Defence barrister Andrew Hoare conceded that based on the new statement there was a case to answer.
Hansen did not enter a plea when he was committed to a Brisbane Supreme Court trial by Magistrate Paul Kluck, who allowed him to remain on bail.
A trial date has not been set.
